Class GoGrid

  • java.lang.Object
    • GoGrid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GoGame

    public class GoGrid
extends java.lang.Object
implements GoGame
    A grid for playing Go, with numbers according to row, 1-19 being the first row and 20-38 being the next, etc.
    Version:
    CS56 2/21/16
    Author:
    David Winkenwerder and Dustin Henderson, Keith Waldron and Nick Abrahan, Jeffrey Liu and Lauren Dumapias
    See Also:
    GoGridTest

      • GoGrid

        public char GoGrid(java.util.ArrayList gameState)
        Constructor for objects of class GoGrid that allows creation of games in middle of play. This is mostly for testing. There should be an equal number of B's and Ws (in which case it is the Ws turn) or else 1 more W that there are Bs (in which case it is Bs turn), otherwise IllegalArgumentException("illegal game state") is thrown.
        Parameters:
        gameState - 362 character string with Ws and Bs for positions 1-362
        Returns:
        turn 'B' or 'W' for turn

      • charAt

        public char charAt(int i)
        Specified by:
        charAt in interface GoGame
        Parameters:
        i - is number of square (like telephone pad)
        Returns:
        'B','W', or ' '--i.e. contents of square i

      • checkSurrounded

        public boolean checkSurrounded(int i,
                               char color)
        checkSurrounded checks to see if the piece selected is surrounded the other players pieces. it returns true if surrounded, and false, if it is not.
        Specified by:
        checkSurrounded in interface GoGame

      • checkSurrounded2

        public boolean checkSurrounded2(int i)
        checkSurrounded2 is like checkSurrounded but it doesn't modify the grid. It is useful for checking whether a move is legal.
        Specified by:
        checkSurrounded2 in interface GoGame

      • setWinner

        public char setWinner(char c)
        This private convenience method sets the gameOver and winner variables, and then returns the winner. It is simply a way to factor out common code from all the cases in getWinner
        Specified by:
        setWinner in interface GoGame

      • getWinner

        public char getWinner()
        Specified by:
        getWinner in interface GoGame
        Returns:
        'W' or 'B' if there is a winner, ' ' if there is not

      • isBlank

        public boolean isBlank(int i)
        is this square blank. Should be called before move() to see whether the move is legal.
        Specified by:
        isBlank in interface GoGame
        Parameters:
        i - number between 1 and 361 indicating square
        Returns:
        whether square is blank or not.
        Throws:
        IllegalArguementException - if i is not between 1 and 361 (inclusive)

      • makeMove

        public boolean makeMove(int i)
                 throws GoIllegalMoveException
        Description copied from interface: GoGame
        play the next move. if isBlank(i) is not true, will throw GoIllegalMoveException.
        Specified by:
        makeMove in interface GoGame
        Parameters:
        i - number between 1 and 361 indicating square, organized like a telephone grid. If i is already occupied, a GoMoveException is thrown.
        Returns:
        winner 'B', 'W', or 'D' for draw, or ' ' for none yet.
        Throws:
        GoIllegalMoveException

        Parameters:

        public char getTurn()
